results.title: Senka (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A young Yugoslavian woman with two small children is caught between her need for friendship and social contact at work, and the difficulties of finding someone to look after her children during the day. The ideal solution to the problem, Kindergarten, is not available to her.

results.title: Selling America. - [Ed. version]
results.creator_credit: General Motors and Jam Handy Organization
results.brief_description: A dramatisation of Benjamin Franklin’s principle of human association as applied to modern salesmanship. The following rules for successful selling are suggested: Get the prospect talking; don’t argue but be pleasant and helpful; agree with the customer, answering “yes…, but…”; don’t contradict and avoid being too positive; make the most use of time, bringing points of direct interest to the customer with other points about the product. An edited version.

results.title: Self defence by plants
results.brief_description: A study of the various self-protective characteristics which are found among plants, including the early seed case, the bud scales and leaf hairs, and the different methods of protection used by leaves and flowers against damage by rain and animals.

results.title: Self-portrait. Parts 1-5
results.brief_description: An anthology of scenes from memorable National Film Board films produced during the years from 1939 to 1960. Text on the screen identifies the film and its makers before each excerpt is shown, and the commentator notes the significant characteristics of each film’s style and subject.

results.title: Self-help
results.brief_description: Villagers in Malaya, living in widely separated huts open to attack by terrorists, clear a new site and move their village to an area more easily protected by police and their newly formed Home Guard unit.

results.title: Selections from the Christmas Oratorio by J.S. Bach
results.creator_credit: David Bairstow, Peter Jones and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: The Montreal Bach Choir under the direction of George Little has sung in many countries. This film presents the choir in one of its most distinguished performances with guest soloists Elizabeth Benson Guy, soprano; Maureen Forrester, contralto; Glenn Schnittke, tenor; Jan Simons, bass; James Ranti, trumpet; and Calvin Sieb, concertmaster.

results.title: Seen but not heard
results.creator_credit: Gillian Coote, Barbara A. Chobocky and New South Wales Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The International Year of the Child presented children with the opportunity to articulate their views on a variety of issues. Here they consider what their rights are, how they deal with them, and also how they resolve their grievances.

results.title: Seen but not heard
results.brief_description: Seen but not Heard probes the often-hidden feelings, attitudes and beliefs of kids in the formative and volatile stages of the early teens. It is a time when privacy, independence and experimentation create a separate world for young people; a world into which adults only rarely get a glimpse. For adolescents, it is a provocative examination of their own lives. For parents, it is an eye-opening insight into the lives of their children. For younger children it is a hint of things to come.
